root:
Business Today: Chamber 2.30pm Prayers Followed by Questions
Urgent Questions and Statements 3.30pm Urgent Questions (if any) Ministerial Statements (if any) Business of the Day Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill: Consideration of Lords Message Up to two hours (Order of 18 March) Notes:
Nothing in the Lords Message engages financial privilege.
For motions and amendments relating to the Lords Amendments, see separate paper (also available on the publications webpage for the Bill). Relevant Documents:
Second Report of the Joint Committee on Human Rights, Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill, HC 435, and the Government response, HC 647
BACKBENCH BUSINESS Until 10.00pm (Standing Order No. 9(3) ) Hospice funding Sally-Ann Hart Peter Gibson
That this House has considered the postcode lottery of funding for hospices; and calls on integrated care boards to urgently address the funding for hospice-provided palliative care in their areas. Notes:
The subject for this debate was determined by the Backbench Business Committee. Adjournment Debate Until 10.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7)) Rights of lesbian, gay, bisexual and gender non-conforming young people: Neale Hanvey Business Today: Westminster Hall Westminster Hall will not be sitting.: Written Statements Statements to be Made Today Secretary of State for Energy Security and Net Zero Energy Infrastructure Planning Projects Deputy Foreign Secretary Hong Kong Six-monthly Report Sudan Conflict Sanctions Secretary of State for Defence AUKUS Update Secretary of State for Health and Social Care Cass Review Update Charges Uplift for NHS Prescriptions, Wigs and Fabric Supports Death Certification Reform and the Introduction of Medical Examiners Lampard Inquiry Update NHS Consultant Workforce Update Secretary of State for Northern Ireland Fourth Update on New Decade, New Approach Secretary of State for Transport Fishers’ medicals Secretary of State for Work and Pensions Changes to Universal Credit Administrative Earnings Threshold Level Fit Note Reform: Call for Evidence Notes: Texts of Written Statements are available from the Vote Office and on the internet at https://questions-statements.parliament.uk/ .
